Title: Lab Blast for Groups
Description: Join us for a wild ride through science, where we will explore different phenomena including buoyancy, water tension and gas expansion. Brightly colored foam tsunamis and loud (controlled) explosions will punctuate this one-hour science experience.

Title: Longleaf Lifelong Hike II
Description: We will continue exploring the longleaf pine restoration efforts in the sandhills with Jeff Marcus, NC Nature Conservancy, who led our visit in March.

Title: Marine Invertebrates Dissection Class
Description: Participants will dissect a squid, a clam, and a blue crab to explore the inner and outer structures of these marine invertebrates.

Title: Marine Vertebrates Dissection Class
Description: Participants will dissect and examine internal as well as external structures of bony and cartilaginous fish.

Title: Math You Can Use
Description: In this class students will actually have fun with math by first learning a couple of easy formulas then going out in the museum to apply them.

Title: Medoc Mountain Lifelong Hike
Description: Our hike will explore the geology, plants and animals of this rare вЂњcoastal plain mountainвЂќ.

Title: Member Exclusive: Director's Adventure to Alberta, Canada
Description: Experience three majestic landscapes each with a fascinating natural and human history, with Museum Director and geologist Emlyn Koster.

Title: Museum paleontologists live from Utah
Description: Come to the Daily Planet Theater at the Museum to speak with project scientists in real-time, or if you canвЂ™t make it, tweet questions to us while watching us live!
